awd_abstract_narration:
The conference "Objective Bayes 2022 Methodology Conference" will be held at the University of California Santa Cruz, in Santa Cruz, CA, on September 6-10, 2022. Focusing on recent developments in objective Bayes theory, methodology and applications, and related topics, the conference will feature one day of tutorials for new researchers and four days of scientific sessions with discussion and a poster session open to all participants. This conference will bring together experts as well as a group of students and young researchers from a broad set of areas within and related to objective Bayesian methodology. The primary goal is to spark the development of new objective Bayesian techniques, which will serve as invaluable tools in various disciplines that deal with modeling uncertainty such as climatology, economics, and ecology. Emphasis will be placed on the interaction between new and established researchers, and researchers in different methodological areas.

Today, more than ever, Bayesian approaches have become increasingly widespread. Driven in part by the computing revolution and the need for principled uncertainty quantification, Bayesian methods are being applied widely across the sciences and within industry settings. The conference is aimed to respond to these demands, and will encompass many aspects of objective Bayesian methodology, from theoretical, to applied and computational. The conference will also cover recent developments in areas such as high-dimensional data analysis, approximate Bayesian computation, Bayesian nonparametric, machine learning, etc. For more details about the conference, please see the conference homepage: https://obayes.soe.ucsc.edu.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
This award supported participants for the Objective Bayes 2022 Methodology Conference, which was held in Santa Cruz, CA from September 6-10, 2022. Focusing on recent developments in objective Bayes theory, methodology and applications, as well as related topics, the conference featured one day of tutorials for new researchers as well as four days of scientific sessions with discussion and a poster session open to all participants. The conference also served as the biennial meeting of the Objective Bayes section of the International Society for Bayesian Analysis (ISBA). This was the 14th meeting of one of the longest running and preeminent meetings within Bayesian statistics.

 

With the help of the NSF award, we were able to offer partial support for 19 junior researchers, most of whom attended an Objective Bayes conference for the first time under the award. These participants were able to present their research within the poster session and network with highly established researchers from around the world. Additionally, they were able to attend short courses on the following topics: “Variable Selection and Model Averaging,” “Bayesian Nonparametrics,” “High Dimensional Bayes,” and “Bayesian Computation.”

 

Beyond the short courses, the conference included 21 outstanding talks, each with floor discussion. These talks covered many areas at the forefront of the field, including approximate Bayesian computation, tree-based priors, variable selection, Bayesian nonparametrics, replicability, and exchangeability, among others.

 

To summarize, the Objective Bayes 2022 Methodology Conference was highly successful, with around 100 participants, 21 invited talks with 21 discussants, 4 short courses, and a poster session with 40 participants.

 


Last Modified: 12/21/2023
Modified by: Paul A Parker
